content.text: “We eat more ice cream as the temperature rises.”
What type of correlation is this?
Write the recurring decimal \(0.8\) as a fraction
The regular pentagon has ..................................... lines of symmetry
The kite has rotational symmetry of order
The diagram shows a regular pentagon and a kite
The diagram shows a regular hexagon \(ABCDEF\)
Find \(\overrightarrow{CA}\) , in terms of \(\mathbf{p}\) and \(\mathbf{q}\) , giving your answer in its simplest form
The population decreases exponentially at a rate of \(1.4\%\) per year
Calculate the population of Newton after 5 years
18% of the 600 cakes go to a hotel and \(\frac{2}{3}\) of the 600 cakes go to a supermarket
Calculate how many cakes he has left
Without using your calculator, work out \(\frac{7}{8} +\frac{1}{6}\)
You must show all your working and give your answer as a mixed number in its simplest form
You must show all your working
The area of triangle \(ADX\) is \(36 \text{cm}^2\) and the area of triangle \(BCX\) is \(65.61 \text{cm}^2\)
\(A, B, C\) and \(D\) are points on the circumference of the circle
Show all your working and give your answers correct to 2 decimal places
In this question, **use a straight edge and compasses only** and show all your construction arcs
Use set notation to complete the statements for the Venn diagram above
List the elements of \((X \cup Y \cup Z)'\)
Describe fully the single transformation that maps
Samira chooses one sweet at random from her bag
Write down the probability that she chooses a yellow sweet
Show that the probability that she chooses two green sweets is \(\frac{3}{38}\)
Calculate the probability that the sweets she chooses are **not** both the same colour
Sonia chooses two sweets at random, without replacement, from her bag
Samira and Sonia each have a bag containing 20 sweets
In each bag, there are 5 red, 6 green and 9 yellow sweets
